title: Unable to find the latest backup of the "Local Folders" section created about a few years ago.
content:
Hello, Recently I was migrated from Cox email to Yahoo mail and had to change my setting on Thunderbird. The emails work fine, but there seems to a lot of missing folders. I tried to look for the latest backup file, but it does not exist. The latest backup I have is of the year 2022.

Kindly assist me in retrieving my lost folders.

p.s I have searched for the folders under the default profile section but they do not exist.
creator: jlaveque

title: TB icon in WIN 10 task bar has no blue line under it when TB is minimized.
content:
I have many programs/apps in my Windows 10 task bar (at the bottom of the screen), and when one of those programs is minimized, the task bar icon for that program has a blue line under the icon, to show that it is still active, but not showing on screen -- that is, except for Thunderbird. If I'm not writing a message in TB at the time I minimize it, there is no blue line under the icon. The problem is: when I'm ready to shut down a session and I've been using Thunderbird at some point in the session and have minimized it, I can't tell from the task bar icon whether TB is active or not, without clicking on the icon. I don't want to have to do that every time I close down the computer, and I don't want to close the session with TB still active. It seems that a simple coding addition would fix the problem, and I can't believe no one else has mentioned the problem. This is not new with 15.1 -- it's been going on for several versions. The ONLY time the icon appears is when there is more than one page of TB open (like Main & Write).

Your prompt response is appreciated. Thanks, engrollie
creator: rehawkpe

title: Can't see threading in Thunderbird.
content:
Basically, when I have a threaded message, I don't see the > to drop down information to show the threads from the subject pane in the subject field.

I have gone to view, sort by threaded. I'm led to believe I should see something like this:

Subject : Top Level of Thread 

 |  ---> Subject : Re: Top Level of Thread       |       ---> Subect : Re: Top Level of Thread

But I see none of that. It's just one flat subject. It doesn't even tell me someone has replied to me. I have to go into the mail to see that. I have added the conversations add on just to get a glance of that, because I'm seeing nothing.

Image attached of what I see.
creator: trash6

title: Email accounts
content: Hi When I send an email they are not going into my "sent" box. They are going into a folder with both my email account addresses i.e. if i send an email from my email account sandy.bell3@bigpond.com it goes into a folder of that email name & the same for my business email account it goes into a folder named csb.wandpc@bigpond.com which came up that obviously was created by you. I would prefer them to go into my proper "sent" folder. How do we fix this. Many thanks. Sandy

title: Gmail has stopped downloading to Thunderbird
content:
Kia Ora, my Gmail account has stopped downloading to Thunderbird.

I hadn't changed any settings before this happened. Have looked for solutions online, the one I saw here suggested changing the saved password in Thunderbird, which I have done, changing three gmail listings to my current gmail password.

The fix here also suggested deleting the current account, but I can't find that either.

Please advise.

Thanks Mark

title: My phone has stopped deleting emails from my laptop.
content: My phone has been deleting emails from my mozilla account and removing them from my laptop. Although I can still delete from my phone they don't delete from my laptop. This system has been working for years and I've only just noticed the problem. I normally use my phone for this so I have about 3 months worth of emails still on the laptop.
creator: hallbrian5745

title: My .thunderbird folder on a PCLinuxOS desktop is almost 800Gb in size!
content:
I've read a few historic suggestions about how to resolve this, but I haven't been comfortable with what solutions were suggested as they didn't seem to comprehensively answer the questions, I'm afraid.

Until this morning's attempts to resolve the "running out of disk space" warnings, I had two mail accounts on Thunderbird - my old Hotmail account and my new personal domain based account. Both accounts had old emails (3/4 years' worth) filed locally on my PC pending my satisfaction that the new mail account was working satisfactorily. To try and resolve the storage issue, I deleted all the locally stored emails from my Hotmail account from within Thunderbird, then deleted the Hotmail account, and restarted both my PC and Thunderbird.

The expected reduction on space occupied by the .thunderbird folder didn't materialise - at all.

How can I get back the space so I can continue working, please?
creator: tim292

title: Thunderbird threading only one deep
content:
Thunderbird 115.11.1 (64-bit) Windows

Hi,

Thunderbird is not threading messages properly. It only seem to go one level deep ...

This is what it shows: aaa ..bbb ..ccc ..ddd ..xxx ..yyy

Where it should be: aaa ..bbb ....ccc ......ddd ..xxx ....yyy

I cannot find a way to fix that.

Help please.
creator: richard.harnden

title: Request for Access to Former Employee Don's Email History
content:
Dear Thunderbird Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

We used Thunderbird for our email services. As part of our current operations, we need to access the past email history of Don, a former employee whose email address was don@polytechfibers.com.

Don has since left the company, but it is crucial for us to retrieve his past emails. Could you please assist us in accessing his email data?

If you need any further information or have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out.

Thank you for your assistance and cooperation.

Please reply to josh@polytechfibers.com

Best regards,

Josh Heo Polytech Fibers
